function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of wearables to detect COVID-19 symptoms may lead to false positives or false negatives, resulting in incorrect diagnoses.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis and unnecessary isolation or lack of isolation, contributing to the spread of the virus.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of wearables with clinical testing, and clear guidance on action to take in case of an alert.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms for more accurate interpretation of biometric data, and integration with clinical diagnostic tools.","People":"Users of wearables, healthcare providers, public health authorities.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Reliance on wearables for early detection of infection may lead to privacy concerns, as biometric data and GPS information are utilized for tracking and alerting individuals.","Impact":"Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive health data, potential stigmatization, and loss of privacy for individuals.","Mitigation":"Implement strong data encryption and access control measures, provide transparent consent processes, and comply with data privacy regulations such as GDPR and HIPAA.","Technologies":"Blockchain technology for secure data storage, biometric encryption algorithms, and privacy-preserving contact tracing methods.","People":"Users of wearables, data security experts, policymakers.","Owner":"Technology companies, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of wearables data could lead to an overreliance on the technology for decision-making, neglecting other important public health measures.","Impact":"Undermining public health efforts, overlooking manual contact tracing, and ignoring broader population health interventions.","Mitigation":"Education on the limitations of wearables, integration of wearables data with traditional public health strategies, and clear communication of the role of wearables in conjunction with other measures.","Technologies":"Data visualization tools for communicating wearables data, interoperability with public health systems.","People":"Public health authorities, policy makers, users of wearables.","Owner":"Public health authorities, technology companies."}]}
